body.p:
Louisville Ky.
Decr 27th 1865
His Excellency
Govr Thos E. Bramlette
Sir

The petitioner Dumont, is of that class of offenders that uses all efforts to preserve order as far as women Can do so Keeping Such houses I Know that afer the Military authorities Vacated her house She had to Morgage her Furniture to refit hir house and is Still in debt under said Morgage I believe that Executive Clemency in this Case would be Simple justice

Your Excellency is aware that
that winter and poverty is now on many of ^those^ unfortunate and having from daly observation a Knowledge of these facts generally, and of many Cases particularlly, I deem it my duty as a humane official to recomend the Case of this Woman Dumont for Your Excellency's favourable Consideration

I am Sir
Very respectfully
Your obt Servt
Wm Hipwell
Lieut Police
